segment.source: To disable the frame rate counters, set EnableFrameRateCounter to false or comment out the line of code.
segment.target: To disable the frame rate counters, set EnableFrameRateCounter to false or comment out the line of code.

segment.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

segment.source: Known Issues
segment.target: Known Issues

segment.source: The following are known issues with the emulator, with suggested ways to work around problems if you encounter them.
segment.target: The following are known issues with the emulator, with suggested ways to work around problems if you encounter them.

segment.source: Error message: “Failed while removing virtual Ethernet switch”
segment.target: Error message: “Failed while removing virtual Ethernet switch”

segment.source: In certain situations, including after you update to a new Windows 10 flight, a virtual network switch associated with the emulator can get into a state where it can't be deleted through the user interface.
segment.target: In certain situations, including after you update to a new Windows 10 flight, a virtual network switch associated with the emulator can get into a state where it can't be deleted through the user interface.

segment.source: To recover from this situation run "netcfg -d" from an administrator command prompt: C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft XDE\<version>\XdeCleanup.exe. When the command is finished running, reboot your computer to complete the recovery process.
segment.target: To recover from this situation run "netcfg -d" from an administrator command prompt: C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft XDE\<version>\XdeCleanup.exe. When the command is finished running, reboot your computer to complete the recovery process.

segment.source: Note This command will delete all networking devices, not just those associated with the emulator.
segment.target: Note This command will delete all networking devices, not just those associated with the emulator.

segment.source: When your computer starts again, all hardware networking devices will be discovered automatically.
segment.target: When your computer starts again, all hardware networking devices will be discovered automatically.

segment.source: Unable to launch the emulators
segment.target: Unable to launch the emulators

segment.source: Microsoft Emulator includes XDECleanup.exe, a tool that deletes all VMs, diff disks, and emulator specific network switches, and it ships with the emulator (XDE) binaries already. You should use this tool to clean up emulator VMs if they get into a bad state. Run the tool from an administrator command prompt:C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft XDE\<version>\XdeCleanup.exe
segment.target: Microsoft Emulator includes XDECleanup.exe, a tool that deletes all VMs, diff disks, and emulator specific network switches, and it ships with the emulator (XDE) binaries already. You should use this tool to clean up emulator VMs if they get into a bad state. Run the tool from an administrator command prompt:C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft XDE\<version>\XdeCleanup.exe

segment.source: Note XDECleanup.exe deletes all emulator specific Hyper-V VMs, and it also deletes any VM checkpoints or saved states.
segment.target: Note XDECleanup.exe deletes all emulator specific Hyper-V VMs, and it also deletes any VM checkpoints or saved states.

segment.source: Uninstall Windows 10 for Mobile Image
segment.target: Uninstall Windows 10 for Mobile Image

segment.source: When you install the emulator, a Windows 10 for Mobile VHD image is installed, which gets its own entry in the Programs and Features list in the Control Panel. If you wish to uninstall the image, find **Windows 10 for Mobile Image - ** in the list of installed programs, right-click on it, and choose Uninstall.
segment.target: When you install the emulator, a Windows 10 for Mobile VHD image is installed, which gets its own entry in the Programs and Features list in the Control Panel. If you wish to uninstall the image, find **Windows 10 for Mobile Image - ** in the list of installed programs, right-click on it, and choose Uninstall.

segment.source: In the current release, you must then manually delete the VHD file for the emulator. If you installed the emulator to the default path, the VHD file is at C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Windows Kits\\10\\Emulation\\Mobile\\\\flash.vhd.
segment.target: In the current release, you must then manually delete the VHD file for the emulator. If you installed the emulator to the default path, the VHD file is at C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Windows Kits\\10\\Emulation\\Mobile\\\\flash.vhd.

segment.target: To find answers and solve problems as you start working with the Windows 10 tools, please visit Windows 10 Tools forum.
